business.headline: US tariffs will not have significant adverse impact on Indian economy: SourcesThe 25% tariff announced by US President Donald Trump will not have a significant adverse impact on the Indian economy, government sources said.

Elon Musk's Starlink to operate soon in India. Check monthly plansUnion Telecom Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia confirmed that Starlink has been awarded a Unified Licence to launch its satellite internet operations in India.
Sensex closes 586 points lower, Nifty below 25,600; Infosys ends 3% downThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 585.67 points to close at 80,599.91, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 203 points to end at 24,565.35.

CA explains why you should not use FDs as an emergency fundAccording to RBI guidelines, banks can charge up to 0.5% to 1.0% of the interest rate as a penalty if FDs are broken before their maturity period.

Indian interests top priority, no chance of compromising due to US tariffs: SourcesAn official said that the government is closely watching the developments but sees no reason for alarm after the US imposed a 25% tariff on India.

Jane Street not cooperating in probe with income tax department: ReportThe firm's servers are located outside India, and officials said they are unable to access them. Additionally, accounts books are also being maintained overseas, even though company law requires them to be kept in India.

Planning to buy a car without taking loan? Here's how you can do itThink you need a big salary or bank loan to own a car? Think again. A thoughtful plan, regular savings, and side gigs helped one man save Rs 7.1 lakh in three years, all without borrowing a rupee. Here's how you can do it too.

Explained: Why PNB Housing Finance Ltd shares crashed 18% todayPNB Housing Finance Ltd share crash: The steep fall followed days of weak performance. Over the past five days, the stock has lost 19.59%, and in the last month, it has dropped 26.53%.

New tax rules coming soon. How the Income Tax Bill 2025 could impact youThe new law aims to make income tax rules easier to understand, reduce legal disputes, and help people comply with tax rules more easily.

Sebi may relax IPO float norms for big firms to just 2.5% equity: ReportAt present, Sebi rules say that any company with a post-issue capital of more than Rs 1 lakh crore must offer 5% equity and raise at least Rs 5,000 crore.

ED investigates Anil Ambani in loan fraud case, summoned on August 5The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has summoned Anil Ambani for questioning on August 5 in the national capital. This is in connection with an investigation into an alleged loan fraud of Rs 12,500 crore. The development follows multiple searches the ED carried out at 35 locations in Mumbai, targeting business entities linked to the Anil Ambani group under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA). The probe agency's action is also based on findings from a separate investigation by the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI). A key point in the investigation is an alleged diversion of funds, with the transcript stating, "The development actually came after the SEBI shared with the enforcement directorate the findings of a separate probe that launched into the alleged diversion of 10,000 crore by the Reliant infrastructure."
Why has ED summoned Anil Ambani on August 5Anil Ambani, chairman and managing director of Reliance Group, has been summoned by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) for questioning on August 5.

entertainment.headline: Aanand L Rai calls AI version of Raanjhanaa a betrayal after producers' statementFilmmaker Aanand L Rai stated in a long note on social media that he neither supports nor approves of the AI-modified version of 'Raanjhanaa', describing it as unauthorised. The film was originally released in 2013.

Housefull 5 OTT release: When and where to watch Akshay Kumar's comedy drama 'Housefull 5', starring Akshay Kumar and Riteish Deshmukh, is now out on Prime Video. Set on a cruise, the film is full of comedy, confusion, and lots of drama as three men claim to be the same person.

Top films and shows to watch on OTT this weekendOTT's new weekend lineup caters to all tastes, featuring a mix of documentaries, anime, dramas, and comedy shows. From thought-provoking political documentaries to thrilling action and heartfelt stories, there is something engaging for every viewer in India.

Exclusive: Sofia Carson, Corey Mylchreest on Bollywood, chemistry, love languageIn an exclusive interaction with India Today, 'My Oxford Year' actors Sofia Carson and Corey Mylchreest spoke about their love for Bollywood and the possibilities of exploring the new sphere.

Janhvi's boyfriend Shikhar Pahariya shared the song on Instagram and called it the best song and tagged her as his best girl.

Kothalavadi review: Old-school screenplay weighs down interesting village dramaRelease Date:Fri Aug 01, 2025Kothalavadi film review: Debutant Sriraj's Kannada film stars Pruthvi Ambar and Gopalkrishna Deshpande. Produced by Yash's mother Pushpa Arunkumar, 'Kothalavadi' explores a clash between the struggling village folk and the police trying to guide them on the right path.

Khushboo Patani clarifies: Remarks directed at Aniruddhacharya, not Premanand JiActor Disha Patani's sister Khusboo Patani clarified that her comments were directed at Aniruddhacharya's misogynistic views and not about spiritual leader Premanand Ji Maharaj.

Saiyaara star Aneet gets touching tribute from her school: Still that girl in uniformLong before she lit up the big screen in 'Saiyaara', Aneet Padda was just a girl in a school uniform, dreaming quietly in a classroom in Amritsar. This week, her alma mater reminded her, and the world, where it all began, with a tribute that brought both tears and gratitude.

Kyunki Episode 3: Tulsi finally gets her due-wrinkles, weight, husband who sees herKyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi new episode: In a rare moment of honesty on Indian television, Mihir tells Tulsi that her wrinkles aren't signs of ageing but marks of sacrifice - lines etched by years of holding her family together.

Aamir Khan to visit Lagaan's Kunariya village after 25 years for Sitaare screeningAamir Khan is set to visit the 'Lagaan' village near Bhuj for the special screening of his film 'Sitaare Zameen Par.' The film released in theatres on June 20.

What Sitaare Zameen Par's pay-per-view release on YouTube means for the industryAamir Khan has taken a bold step by releasing his film 'Sitaare Zameen Par' on YouTube via pay-per-view for Rs 100, marking a fresh attempt to revive TVOD in India. This move challenges traditional theatrical norms and aims to leverage YouTube's massive reach.

The film invites viewers to cherish moments of love beyond grand gestures and melodrama.

In this week's K-fix we will discuss why 'What's Wrong with Secretary Kim' is the perfect beginner-friendly Korean drama packed with romance, comedy, and classic tropes that will leave you hooked.

Peon gives urine to senior when asked for water in Odisha, arrestedA peon in Odisha was arrested for allegedly handing a bottle of urine to his senior officer instead of drinking water, leading to the officer's hospitalisation. The incident occurred in Gajapati district.

Don't pay heed: Poll body rebuts Rahul Gandhi's 'vote theft' chargeThe Election Commission dismissed Rahul Gandhi's allegations of vote theft as baseless and urged officials to ignore such "irresponsible statements." Engines dead, pilots glided plane for 120km over ocean, saved 306 livesWhen both engines of Transat Flight 236 from Canada to Portugal died out midair over the Atlantic Ocean in 2001 due to a fuel leak, it was still 120km short of an airstrip. The pilots glided the plane to safety, creating a world record and saving 306 people onboard, in what is now known as the Miracle on the Azores.

Where is Lt Col Purohit after fighting Malegaon blast taint for 17 years?Lt Col Prasad Shrikant Purohit has been acquitted by an NIA court in the Malegaon blast case, along with 6 others. The only serving Army officer to stand trial, Purohit was at the centre of a case framed as part of "saffron terror". This is the story of a soldier's 17-year battle in a case that upturned his and his family's lives.

Who is Khalid Jamil? The man trusted to lead Indian football's revivalKhalid Jamil has been appointed head coach of the Indian men's national football team, the first Indian in the role in over ten years. His task is to revive Indian football and steer the team to better performances in upcoming tournaments.

India assistant coach reacts to Shubman Gill's unfortunate run outShubman Gill came under fire from fans for a careless run-out on Day 1 of the final Test, with India's assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate also highlighting the recklessness of the dismissal during the post-match media interaction.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
